nodes.text: Good Neighbor of the Year award

The Good Neighbor of the Year award was an award annually given out by the Coruscant Benevolent Society on the planet Coruscant during the reign of the Galactic Republic. Due to his helpful nature, the Kedorzhan Senator Dewell Bronk earned the award three times while he lived on Coruscant.

The Good Neighbor of the Year award was first mentioned in the short story "Incognito", which was published in Star Wars Insider 143 in 2013. The story was written by John Jackson Miller as a tie in to his then upcoming novel, Kenobi.
